item.title: Hmm... what do i do wrong... something with seconds, going too fast
item.dc:creator: @r.v.d.p r.v.d.p
item.description:
@r.v.d.p wrote:

Hi!

I’m making a script that runs on it own.
The script shows how long it’s running till the Mini Seconds.
The only problem is:
[size=15pt]I THINK MY SECONDS ARE GOING TOO FAST![/size]
I did asked more that once for this, but I still don’t get 100% of how it works.
Maybe someone could say how many of my “iliMiliSeconds” there are in a Mili Second instead of 10?
thanks, btw here’s script:

[code]public class Test
{
static int iliMiliSeconds = 0;//10 of these should be 1 mSecond
static int mSeconds = 0;
static int Seconds = 0;
static int Minutes = 0;
static int Hours = 0;
public static void main(String[] args)
{
int Loop = 1;
while (Loop <= 2)
{
iliMiliSeconds();//10 of these should be 1 mSecond
mSeconds();
Seconds();
Minutes();
Hours();
System.out.println(Hours+":"+Minutes+":"+Seconds+":"+mSeconds);
}
}

public static void iliMiliSeconds()//10 of these should be 1 mSecond
{
iliMiliSeconds++;
}

public static void mSeconds()
{
if(iliMiliSeconds==10)
{
mSeconds++;
iliMiliSeconds = 0;
}
}

public static void Seconds()
{
if(mSeconds==1000)
{
Seconds++;
mSeconds = 0;
}
}

public static void Minutes()
{
if(Seconds==60)
{
Minutes++;
Seconds = 0;
}
}

public static void Hours()
{
if(Minutes==60)
{
Hours++;
Minutes = 0;
}
}
}

[/code]
